verses.text: And Isaac called Jacob , and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
Arise , go to Padan-aram , to the house of Bethuel thy mother’s father ; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother’s brother.
And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful , and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people ;\f + \fr 28.3 \ft a multitude…: Heb. an assembly of people\f*

And give thee the blessing of Abraham , to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger , which God gave unto Abraham.\f + \fr 28.4 \ft wherein…: Heb. of thy sojournings\f*
And Isaac sent away Jacob : and he went to Padan-aram unto Laban , son of Bethuel the Syrian , the brother of Rebekah , Jacob’s and Esau’s mother. \p

¶ When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob , and sent him away to Padan-aram , to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge , saying , Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan ;
And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother , and was gone to Padan-aram ;
And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father ;\f + \fr 28.8 \ft pleased…: Heb. were evil in the eyes, etc\f*

Then went Esau unto Ishmael , and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham’s son , the sister of Nebajoth , to be his wife.\f + \fr 28.9 \ft Mahalath: or, Bashemath\f* \p
¶ And Jacob went out from Beer-sheba , and went toward Haran.\f + \fr 28.10 \ft Haran: Gr. Charran\f*

And he lighted upon a certain place , and tarried there all night , because the sun was set ; and he took of the stones of that place , and put \add them for\add* his pillows , and lay down in that place to sleep.
And he dreamed , and behold a ladder set up on the earth , and the top of it reached to heaven : and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.

And, behold, the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* stood above it, and said , I \add am\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Abraham thy father , and the God of Isaac : the land whereon thou liest , to thee will I give it , and to thy seed ;

And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth , and thou shalt spread abroad to the west , and to the east , and to the north , and to the south : and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.\f + \fr 28.14 \ft spread…: Heb. break forth\f*

And, behold, I \add am\add* with thee, and will keep thee in all \add places\add* whither thou goest , and will bring thee again into this land ; for I will not leave thee, until I have done \add that\add* which I have spoken to thee of. \p
¶ And Jacob awaked out of his sleep , and he said , Surely the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is in this place ; and I knew \add it\add* not.
And he was afraid , and said , How dreadful \add is\add* this place ! this \add is\add* none other but the house of God , and this \add is\add* the gate of heaven.
And Jacob rose up early in the morning , and took the stone that he had put \add for\add* his pillows , and set it up \add for\add* a pillar , and poured oil upon the top of it.
And he called the name of that place Beth-el : but the name of that city \add was called\add* Luz at the first.\f + \fr 28.19 \ft Beth-el: that is, The house of God\f*
And Jacob vowed a vow , saying , If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go , and will give me bread to eat , and raiment to put on ,
So that I come again to my father’s house in peace ; then shall the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* be my God :
And this stone , which I have set \add for\add* a pillar , shall be God’s house : and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
